buildings.headline: Research House No. 1 was built from prefabricated concrete parts and has external insulation. A dispersion putty and paint were used as the interior coating.
buildings.text: Due to the high storage mass, the house showed very good heat storage behaviour and, in combination with the thermal insulation used, offered good protection against overheating in summer and against rapid cooling down in winter. The relatively low storage capacity of the inner coating resulted in low moisture buffering.

products.name: Baumit StarContact white
products.additional_name: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit StarSystems. Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Very flexible, extremely weather-resistant, with excellent workability, guaranteeing long lasting performance. Formulated for demanding applications, weather conditions during processing and demanding substrates.
products.experts_advice_2: Create the reinforcement layer by applying 10 mm adhesive mortar with a notched trowel to the substrate. Press vertical strips of Baumit StarTex fibre-glass mesh into the fresh mortar with 10 cm overlap and then (or after applying additional material) smooth the surface. The reinforcement must not be visible. Reinforcement layer thickness min. 3 mm, max. 6 mm.
products.experts_advice: Baumit StarContact adhesive mortar can also be used for bonding and mortaring plinth XPS and EPS Perimeter insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Highly flexible cement adhesive mortar suitable for bonding and mortaring all insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_2_description: The façade plaster can be applied directly on the reinforced layer.
products.product_benefit_3_description: With excellent applicability, with guaranteed long life and rapid curing period.
products.sd_value: app. 0.15 m for a layer thickness of 3 mm

products.additional_name: Facade insulation board with extremely high thermal insulation

Both sides covered with grey EPS-F.

products.product_benefit_2_description: Ideal at insulations where high thicknesses of common insulation are considered.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Effective thicknesses of insulation do not increase the thickness of window reveal, and so more light gets inside.

products.experts_advice_2: If necessary, for instance in case of very hot weather, consistency of the prime coat can be modified by adding of 5% water, max. 1 l water/25 kg bucket. An excessive dilution of the paint can cause “chalking” of the surface.
products.experts_advice: Before application of Baumit PremiumPrimer, carefully mix, and overall apply on the substrate by a roller or a paintbrush evenly without any interruption. Curing time min. 24 hrs.

Available colored in the Baumit Life shades with the last digit 7, 8 and 9. Wet abrasion class: 3; Opacity: 2 at 7 m² / l; Degree  of gloss: dull matt. 1 liter ≙ approx. 1.6 kilograms.
products.experts_advice_2: Store securely sealed and in a cool and frost-free location. Can be stored unopened, in the original container, for 12 months.
products.experts_advice: Baumit Divina Classic may, in keeping with the coating build-up, be dilluted with water up to a maximum of 5%.

seo.description: Breathable interior dispersion paint with good coverage, in E.L.F. quality. Can be tinted with alkali-resistant solid colours or basic and tinting colours.

headline_t.int: Research House No. 1 was built from prefabricated concrete parts and has external insulation. A dispersion putty and paint were used as the interior coating.
headline_t.fr: Research house 1 is a house with concrete walls coated with paint.

text_t.int: Due to the high storage mass, the house showed very good heat storage behaviour and, in combination with the thermal insulation used, offered good protection against overheating in summer and against rapid cooling down in winter. The relatively low storage capacity of the inner coating resulted in low moisture buffering.
text_t.fr: The house thus has large areas capable of storage with a relatively high level of thermal effusivity. The thermal capacity of the house was assessed as „high“. The high level of thermal effusivity of concrete and the exterior heat insulation offers protection from summer overheating. The capacity of the moisture buffering is low, due amongst other things to the low absorption moisture storage capacity.

buildings.headline: House No. 2 is comparable to Building No. 1 in terms of the wall construction. The biggest difference is the diffusion-open, mineral inner coating that is used there.
buildings.text: This ensured significantly better moisture regulation and contributed to a reduction in moisture peaks. This is due to the moisture penetration coefficient, which was significantly higher for this interior coating than for house No. 1. With regard to overheating in summer, it can be seen that the indoor temperatures in houses 1 and 2 were low in summer, which is due to the external thermal insulation and the high specific building wall masses.

products.name: Baumit openTherm
products.description: White, breathable facade insulating panels made from EPS (expanded polystyrene) specially designed for brickwork and similarly breathable masonry with very good thermal insulation properties. System component of Baumit open.
products.experts_advice_2: In the area of the base min. We recommend using XPS or EPS Perimeter non-absorbent insulation panels 30 cm over the terrain.
products.experts_advice: For bonding and mortaring we recommend using Baumit OpenContact adhesive mortar.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Insulation panel made from EPS for simple handling and application.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Ideal for insulating masonry with high vapour permability, such as porous concrete.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Part of the Baumit Open thermal insulation system for optimal interior temperature and pleasant living.

seo.title: Baumit openTherm
seo.description: White, breathable façade insulating panels made from EPS (expanded polystyrene) in accordance with ÖNORM EN 13163 (μ-value ≤ 10), specially designed for brickwork and similarly breathable mas

products.name: Baumit openContact
products.additional_name: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit openSystem. Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Highly vapor permeable, very flexible, extremely resistant to weathering featuring excellent workability. For objects with highest quality demands on indoor climate - for a house that breaths.
products.experts_advice_2: Generally speaking, the Baumit OpenContact system is used for thermal insulation anywhere where a thermal insulation system with a high level of water vapour permeability is required, and thus also for the thermal insulation of porous concrete block walls. We therefore recommend the specific evaluation of the thermal insulation recommendation for thermal insulation for the structure in question and that you take into account the specific type of porous concrete brick. Our colleagues at the Baumit Consultancy Centre will be happy to assist you in this regard.
products.experts_advice_3: Thanks to the white putty, you can easily check whether Baumit OpenContact was actually used on your façade!
products.experts_advice: On account of its good adhesive properties, Baumit OpenContact can be used for gluing (or smoothing) XPS insulating panels. N.B. in this case the high water vapour permeability of the material no longer applies.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Particularly suitable for structures with higher demands for interior quality.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Adhesive mortar for bonding and mortaring insulation panels in the Baumit Open system.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Exceptional quality adhesive mortar, highly flexible and with excellent workability.

seo.title: Baumit openContact
seo.description: Breathable, mineral-based, fibre-reinforced, white powder adhesive and plaster undercoat – specially developed for Baumit Open - KlimaFaçade.

headline_t.int: House No. 2 is comparable to Building No. 1 in terms of the wall construction. The biggest difference is the diffusion-open, mineral inner coating that is used there.
headline_t.fr: Concrete is the most commonly used building material for houses. Due to their high storage mass, concrete houses have excellent heat storage behavior and, in combination with heat insulation,

text_t.int: This ensured significantly better moisture regulation and contributed to a reduction in moisture peaks. This is due to the moisture penetration coefficient, which was significantly higher for this interior coating than for house No. 1. With regard to overheating in summer, it can be seen that the indoor temperatures in houses 1 and 2 were low in summer, which is due to the external thermal insulation and the high specific building wall masses.
text_t.fr: The high thermal capacity offers protection from summer overheating. The interior plaster means there is little fluctuation of the inner surface temperature. Due to its interior plaster, house 1 has a much higher moisture penetration coefficient than house 2. The substantial improvement in the moisture buffering caused by this was also verified experimentally with the research houses.

For objects with highest quality demands on indoor climate - for a house that breaths.
products.experts_advice_2: Generally speaking, the Baumit OpenContact system is used for thermal insulation anywhere where a thermal insulation system with a high level of water vapour permeability is required, and thus also for the thermal insulation of porous concrete block walls. We therefore recommend the specific evaluation of the thermal insulation recommendation for thermal insulation for the structure in question and that you take into account the specific type of porous concrete brick. Our colleagues at the Baumit Consultancy Centre will be happy to assist you in this regard.
products.experts_advice_3: Thanks to the white putty, you can easily check whether Baumit OpenContact was actually used on your façade!
products.experts_advice: On account of its good adhesive properties, Baumit OpenContact can be used for gluing (or smoothing) XPS insulating panels. N.B. in this case the high water vapour permeability of the material no longer applies.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Particularly suitable for structures with higher demands for interior quality.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Adhesive mortar for bonding and mortaring insulation panels in the Baumit Open system.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Exceptional quality adhesive mortar, highly flexible and with excellent workability.

products.description: Ready-to-use, universally usable primer to equalize absorption and acts as bonding agent for all Baumit ETIC- and plaster systems. The added grain makes it easier to apply and structure all top coats. Can be colored - see product data sheet for detailed information.
products.experts_advice_2: If necessary, for instance in case of very hot weather, consistency of the prime coat can be modified by adding of 5% water, max. 1 l water/25 kg bucket. An excessive dilution of the paint can cause “chalking” of the surface.

seo.description: Pre-treatment for mineral-based surfaces, as a means of absorption compensation and as a bonding agent for subsequent coating with mineral-based or decorative paste plasters.

products.name: Baumit StarTop
products.description: Highly weather-resistant facade render with silicone binder and new functional filler. The all new Drypor effect guarantees a quick-drying facade surface after rain, fog and condensation.
products.experts_advice_2: New recipe enables the expansion of the assortment of paint color tones. StarTop plaster is available in up to 758 colors, i.e. in all shades of Baumit Life (ending digits 2 through 9), with the exception of the most saturated colors (ending digit 1). Also available in all structures.
products.experts_advice_3: With the hydrophilic capabilities of the render, the surface of your façade will dry out in moist weather far sooner than with regular renders. Hydrophobic characteristics also provide rapid drainage of raindrops from the surface. The combination of both functions keeps the surface dry and also more resistant to dirt and algae.
products.experts_advice: If you’re longing for an absolutely gleaming façade, reach for StarTop render in Life 0019 shade. Special ingredients and pigments ensure whiter shades.
products.product_benefit_1_description: The combination of hydrophilic and hydrophobic characteristics reduces the load of the façade surface due to moisture.
products.product_benefit_2_description: With its rapid drying surface, your façade will be more resistant to dirt and the effects of microorganisms.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Simple application ensures a good result in each of the six structures offered.

products.name: Baumit KlimaWhite
products.description: Natural-white, moisture-regulating lightweight lime plaster with hydraulic binding agent for mechanical processing indoors.
products.experts_advice_2: Research at the Institute for Building Protection IfB (Institut für Bautenschutz) shows the ability of calcium renders to clear pollutants from the air very quickly. All measurements in an experimental room showed that for example the sulphur oxide concentration was lowered to a half within 3 minutes. (Source: COVISS - independent magazine)
products.experts_advice: Sufficient mass volume of the plaster (recommended thickness 2 cm) allows for thermal accumulation and protects the interior from overheating in summer, while radiation of accumulated heat ensures comfortable interior temperatures in the interim or winter period. In addition to insulation render also contributes to create a comfortable interior climate, The ability of render to accumulate heat is not only pleasant but also contributes to savings on the cost of heating and cooling.
products.product_benefit_1_description: The structure of the plaster absorbs moisture from its surroundings and returns it in the event of a decrease in moisture.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Antibacterial effects, reduced risk of mold, and reduced smell due to lime hydrate content.
products.product_benefit_3_description: High permeability supports fast transfer of moisture and prevents condensation.
products.max_thickness: 25 mm per coat (on a new substrate)

headline_t.int: As with House No. 3, Research Huilding No. 4 was built with perforated bricks. However, it has an ETIC system. Mineral, diffusion-open products were used as the interior coating.
headline_t.fr: Average thermal capacity was determined with the heat-insulated brick house with heat insulation and interior plaster.

text_t.int: The house was solidly in the middle range in terms of both heat storage behaviour and protection against overheating in summer. The very good moisture buffering ability of the plaster is due to the great sorption properties and the diffusion capabilities of the interior coating that is used.
text_t.fr: In the course of the summer overheating investigations, an average temperature level was measured for house 4. The influence of the interior coating on moisture storage capacity was verified with house 4. The good sorption characteristics of the interior plaster used resulted in a high level of moisture buffering.

parameters.parameter_name: Protection against overheating in the summer
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A higher value means a higher protection against overheating of the interior in summer.
A higher value means a more stable temperature.
A higher value means the wall can regulate the humidity better.

parameters.parameter_name: Fluctuation of the inner surface temperature
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A lower value means a more balanced indoor temperature feeling.
A higher value means better protection against outdoor noise.
A higher value means better acoustics due to better protection against echo.

parameters.parameter_name: Absorption of high frequency electromagnetic fields
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A higher value means a better protection against the most common mobile frequencies.
A lower value means less noticeable odour

products.name: Baumit StarContact white
products.additional_name: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit StarSystems. Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Very flexible, extremely weather-resistant, with excellent workability, guaranteeing long lasting performance. Formulated for demanding applications, weather conditions during processing and demanding substrates.
products.experts_advice_2: Create the reinforcement layer by applying 10 mm adhesive mortar with a notched trowel to the substrate. Press vertical strips of Baumit StarTex fibre-glass mesh into the fresh mortar with 10 cm overlap and then (or after applying additional material) smooth the surface. The reinforcement must not be visible. Reinforcement layer thickness min. 3 mm, max. 6 mm.
products.experts_advice: Baumit StarContact adhesive mortar can also be used for bonding and mortaring plinth XPS and EPS Perimeter insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Highly flexible cement adhesive mortar suitable for bonding and mortaring all insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_2_description: The façade plaster can be applied directly on the reinforced layer.
products.product_benefit_3_description: With excellent applicability, with guaranteed long life and rapid curing period.
products.sd_value: app. 0.15 m for a layer thickness of 3 mm

Both sides covered with grey EPS-F.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Even small thicknesses of insulation ensure high thermal insulation properties, and also save the space.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Ideal at insulations where high thicknesses of common insulation are considered.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Effective thicknesses of insulation do not increase the thickness of window reveal, and so more light gets inside.

products.name: Baumit StarContact white
products.additional_name: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit StarSystems. products.experts_advice_2: Create the reinforcement layer by applying 10 mm adhesive mortar with a notched trowel to the substrate. headline_t.int: House No. 6 was built with a timber frame construction with plasterboard and has external insulation.
headline_t.fr: House 6 is a house with a wooden stud structure with low specific mass.

text_t.int: The low storage mass of the wall material led to high fluctuations in the wall surface and indoor temperatures and thus to low protection from overheating. The simultaneous low moisture buffer effect resulted from the low sorption capacity of the wall interior coating and the construction-related breathable membrane.
text_t.fr: The final coating applied was a coating with low sorption capacity for water vapour. The low storage mass of the wall material results in a high fluctuation in room temperatures and thus to a low level of protection from summer overheating. The simultaneously low moisture buffer effect results from the low sorption capacity of the inner layers of the wall material and the need for an interior vapour barrier.

products.experts_advice_2: If necessary, for instance in case of very hot weather, consistency of the prime coat can be modified by adding of 5% water, max. 1 l water/25 kg bucket. An excessive dilution of the paint can cause “chalking” of the surface.
products.experts_advice: Before application of Baumit PremiumPrimer, carefully mix, and overall apply on the substrate by a roller or a paintbrush evenly without any interruption. Curing time min. 24 hrs.

products.name: Baumit CreativTop
products.description: Ready-to-use, highly weather-resistant, silicone-reinforced finishing render with a new, functional filler for quick re-drying facade surfaces after rain, fog and condensation. Modelable render for a creative exterior facade design. For manual or machine application.
products.experts_advice_2: The individual appearance of your façade or room does not just come down to colour. Put some thought into it, be creative and give the wall any conceivable texture, with CreativTop in Max, Trend and Fine granularities, which can be freely molded.
products.experts_advice: Tip: at www.baumit.com you can find some design suggestions and you also have unlimited options when it comes to designing new textures.
products.sd_value: 0.07 m - 0.08 m for a layer thickness of 2 mm

products.name: Baumit StarColor
products.description: Highly weather-resistant facade paint with silicone binder and new functional filler. The all new Drypor effect guarantees a quick-drying facade surface after rain, fog and condensation.
products.experts_advice_2: If the substrate releases sand, absorbs water or is uneven, we recommend using the Baumit deep substrate as the prime coat. After the 12-hours curing time, apply the top coat Baumit StarColor. If necessary, it can be diluted with max. 5% water.
products.experts_advice: The prime coat is made by dilution of paint with 10 to 15 % of water. After drying for app. 12 hours, 1 to 2 top undiluted coats are applied. Consistency can be modified, if necessary, by adding of max. 5% water.
products.gloss_level: G3 matt according to DIN EN 1062-1

buildings.headline: Like House No. 6, House No. 7 has a timber frame construction and differs from it mainly with regard to the interior coating.
buildings.text: It demonstrated low heat storage capacity and low protection from summer overheating. This is expressed by, among other things, the strong fluctuation of the wall surface temperature. With regard to moisture buffering, this building performed significantly better than No. 6, due to the better sorption and moisture buffering ability of the interior coating.

products.name: Baumit StarContact white
products.additional_name: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit StarSystems. Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Very flexible, extremely weather-resistant, with excellent workability, guaranteeing long lasting performance. Formulated for demanding applications, weather conditions during processing and demanding substrates.
products.experts_advice_2: Create the reinforcement layer by applying 10 mm adhesive mortar with a notched trowel to the substrate. Press vertical strips of Baumit StarTex fibre-glass mesh into the fresh mortar with 10 cm overlap and then (or after applying additional material) smooth the surface. The reinforcement must not be visible. Reinforcement layer thickness min. 3 mm, max. 6 mm.
products.experts_advice: Baumit StarContact adhesive mortar can also be used for bonding and mortaring plinth XPS and EPS Perimeter insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Highly flexible cement adhesive mortar suitable for bonding and mortaring all insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_2_description: The façade plaster can be applied directly on the reinforced layer.
products.product_benefit_3_description: With excellent applicability, with guaranteed long life and rapid curing period.
products.sd_value: app. 0.15 m for a layer thickness of 3 mm

headline_t.int: Like House No. 6, House No. 7 has a timber frame construction and differs from it mainly with regard to the interior coating.
headline_t.fr: The house with a wooden stud structure differs from house 6 primarily due to the final coating.

text_t.int: It demonstrated low heat storage capacity and low protection from summer overheating. This is expressed by, among other things, the strong fluctuation of the wall surface temperature. With regard to moisture buffering, this building performed significantly better than No. 6, due to the better sorption and moisture buffering ability of the interior coating.
text_t.fr: It displays a low thermal capacity and low protection from summer overheating. The areas with a low heat storage effect result in high fluctuations of the inner surface temperatures. In terms of the moisture buffering effect, the effect of the final coating applied was verified. In this respect, the improved sorption capacity of the final coating resulted in quicker moisture absorption, with the result that there was an improvement in moisture buffering compared with house 6. As a result of this, house 7 displayed an average capacity to buffer the interior air humidity.

products.experts_advice_2: Research at the Institute for Building Protection IfB (Institut für Bautenschutz) shows the ability of calcium renders to clear pollutants from the air very quickly. All measurements in an experimental room showed that for example the sulphur oxide concentration was lowered to a half within 3 minutes. (Source: COVISS - independent magazine)
products.experts_advice: Sufficient mass volume of the plaster (recommended thickness 2 cm) allows for thermal accumulation and protects the interior from overheating in summer, while radiation of accumulated heat ensures comfortable interior temperatures in the interim or winter period. In addition to insulation render also contributes to create a comfortable interior climate, The ability of render to accumulate heat is not only pleasant but also contributes to savings on the cost of heating and cooling.
products.product_benefit_1_description: The structure of the plaster absorbs moisture from its surroundings and returns it in the event of a decrease in moisture.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Antibacterial effects, reduced risk of mold, and reduced smell due to lime hydrate content.
products.product_benefit_3_description: High permeability supports fast transfer of moisture and prevents condensation.
products.max_thickness: 25 mm per coat (on a new substrate)

products.name: Baumit StarContact white
products.additional_name: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Top quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit StarSystems. Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Very flexible, extremely weather-resistant, with excellent workability, guaranteeing long lasting performance. Formulated for demanding applications, weather conditions during processing and demanding substrates.
products.experts_advice_2: Create the reinforcement layer by applying 10 mm adhesive mortar with a notched trowel to the substrate. Press vertical strips of Baumit StarTex fibre-glass mesh into the fresh mortar with 10 cm overlap and then (or after applying additional material) smooth the surface. The reinforcement must not be visible. Reinforcement layer thickness min. 3 mm, max. 6 mm.
products.experts_advice: Baumit StarContact adhesive mortar can also be used for bonding and mortaring plinth XPS and EPS Perimeter insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Highly flexible cement adhesive mortar suitable for bonding and mortaring all insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_2_description: The façade plaster can be applied directly on the reinforced layer.
products.product_benefit_3_description: With excellent applicability, with guaranteed long life and rapid curing period.
products.sd_value: app. 0.15 m for a layer thickness of 3 mm

products.name: Baumit PremiumPrimer

products.description: Ready-to-use, universally usable primer to equalize absorption and acts as bonding agent for all Baumit ETIC- and plaster systems. The added grain makes it easier to apply and structure all top coats. Can be colored - see product data sheet for detailed information.
products.experts_advice_2: If necessary, for instance in case of very hot weather, consistency of the prime coat can be modified by adding of 5% water, max. 1 l water/25 kg bucket. An excessive dilution of the paint can cause “chalking” of the surface.
products.experts_advice: Before application of Baumit PremiumPrimer, carefully mix, and overall apply on the substrate by a roller or a paintbrush evenly without any interruption. Curing time min. 24 hrs.

products.description: Ready-to-use, highly weather-resistant, silicone-reinforced finishing render with a new, functional filler for quick re-drying facade surfaces after rain, fog and condensation. Modelable render for a creative exterior facade design. For manual or machine application.
products.experts_advice_2: The individual appearance of your façade or room does not just come down to colour. Put some thought into it, be creative and give the wall any conceivable texture, with CreativTop in Max, Trend and Fine granularities, which can be freely molded.
products.experts_advice: Tip: at www.baumit.com you can find some design suggestions and you also have unlimited options when it comes to designing new textures.

buildings.headline: This house was built with a solid construction – 50 cm bricks with core insulation.
buildings.text: It had an average heat storage capacity. Due to this characteristic, protection against summer overheating was rated as being “average”. In terms of room humidity, the building had a relatively high buffer effect, which can be attributed to the good sorption capacity of the interior plaster and the low diffusion resistance of the masonry.

parameters.parameter_name: Protection against overheating in the summer
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A higher value means a higher protection against overheating of the interior in summer.
A higher value means a more stable temperature.
A higher value means the wall can regulate the humidity better.

parameters.parameter_name: Fluctuation of the inner surface temperature
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A lower value means a more balanced indoor temperature feeling.
A higher value means better protection against outdoor noise.
A higher value means better acoustics due to better protection against echo.

parameters.parameter_name: Absorption of high frequency electromagnetic fields
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A higher value means a better protection against the most common mobile frequencies.
A lower value means less noticeable odour
200 visitors rated the individual research houses according to their subjective feelings and subjective level of comfort

products.name: Baumit Grund
products.color_text: blue
products.description: Solvent-free, water-dilutable, universal primer for leveling the absorption of mineral substrates.
products.experts_advice_2: Mix thoroughly before applying primer. When applying to a very absorbing base it is possible to dilute with max. 10% water. Apply to whole surface using roller or painting brush.
products.experts_advice: Penetration coat on the base has to settle softly (approx.15 min), must not dry out. With bases sensitive to moisture, such as plaster and anhydrit the curing time is somewhat longer, approx. 12 hours.

products.name: Baumit BetoHaft
products.description: Mineral adhesive bridge for all applications on vertical and horizontal concrete areas.
products.experts_advice_2: Examine potential reinforcement in the substrate. Uncover, clean and paint the reinforcement with rust by e.g. Baumit BetoProtect.
products.experts_advice_3: Apply the adhesion bridge on the surface by a brush to reach a perfect covering. Apply the next layer (e.g. Baumit BetoFill) to the still fresh adhesion bridge.
products.experts_advice: Delimit the substrate by perpendicular cuts, and remove uncompact parts. Clean the substrate and remove dust. 1 Moisten the substrate one day before application of the contact bridge.

headline_t.int: This house was built with a solid construction – 50 cm bricks with core insulation.
headline_t.fr: This house was a house with solid construction that was equipped with 50-inch tiles with interior heat insulation as its construction material.

text_t.int: It had an average heat storage capacity. Due to this characteristic, protection against summer overheating was rated as being “average”. In terms of room humidity, the building had a relatively high buffer effect, which can be attributed to the good sorption capacity of the interior plaster and the low diffusion resistance of the masonry.
text_t.fr: It displayed an average level of thermal capacity. Due to average characteristics, the protection from summer overheating and the fluctuations in the inner surface temperatures was assessed as "average". In terms of moisture, house 9 displayed a relatively high moisture buffering effect. This high buffering capacity is caused by the very good sorption capacity of used interior plaster supported by the low diffusion resistance of the mural.

buildings.headline: This house was built from solid, glued squared timber onto which wood fibre insulation was applied.
buildings.text: Due to its construction, it had an average heat storage capacity with low protection against overheating in summer. The fluctuations in the wall surface temperatures were higher than in houses with a high building mass but lower than in the timber frame construction. The moisture buffering ability was very good, which is attributable to the use of open wooden surfaces.

products.additional_name: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit openSystem. products.experts_advice_2: Generally speaking, the Baumit OpenContact system is used for thermal insulation anywhere where a thermal insulation system with a high level of water vapour permeability is required, and thus also for the thermal insulation of porous concrete block walls. headline_t.int: This house was built from solid, glued squared timber onto which wood fibre insulation was applied.
headline_t.fr: This solid wood construction house was fitted with additional heat insulation.

text_t.int: Due to its construction, it had an average heat storage capacity with low protection against overheating in summer. The fluctuations in the wall surface temperatures were higher than in houses with a high building mass but lower than in the timber frame construction. The moisture buffering ability was very good, which is attributable to the use of open wooden surfaces.
text_t.fr: Due to the solid wood construction, house 10 displayed average thermal capacity with low protection from summer overheating. The surface temperature fluctuation was higher than with concrete houses, although lower than the houses with wooden stud construction. The fluctuation of the inner surface temperature was assessed as "average". The moisture buffering for house 10 was affected by the sorption capacity of the construction material used. Due to the good sorption capacity, house 10 displayed a high moisture buffering effect.

buildings.headline: House No. 11 was built in solid brick construction without thermal insulation.
buildings.text:
The heat storage behaviour had only a minor effect due to the lack of external insulation. This was reflected in the fact there is only moderate protection against overheating in summer and strong cooling of the outer walls in winter.
The moisture buffering was classified as low due to the low sorption capacity of the interior plaster and the interior paint that were used.

products.name: Baumit NHL Pre
products.additional_name: Cement-free NHL-based pre-spray mortar for manual and machine applicat
products.description: Cement-free NHL-based pre-spray mortar for manual and machine application as a pretreatment of Baumit NHL plasters. Specially developed for the renovation of historical buildings and monument protection. Grain size 4 mm.
products.experts_advice_2: Baumit NHL Pre-sprayed coat can be applied on the substrate manually by a trowel or mechanically by a plastering machine. Apply the mixed mortar within 30 min.
products.experts_advice_3: Curing time before application of next layers (e.g. Baumit NHL manual plaster, NHL thermo plaster) is min. 3 days
products.experts_advice: Baumit NHL Pre-sprayed coat can be used as a contact bridge to enhance gripping, and regulate absorption of mineral substrates, such as brick, stone etc.
products.product_benefit_3: especially for the protection of historic building

seo.title: Baumit NHL Pre
seo.description: Special pre-sprayed coat for preparation of the substrate before application of NHL plasters. Traditional material without cement. Granularity 4 mm.

products.name: Baumit NHL MP
products.description: Cement-free, NHL-based machine plaster for use in historic buildings and the protection of historic monuments for exterior and interior use. Grain size 2 mm.
products.experts_advice_2: In case of application of multiple layers, apply the first layer with thickness max. 25 mm and roughen horizontally. Apply the second layer of plaster after the curing time of app. 12 hours. The surface treatment (façade plaster or coat) can be applied only after the sufficient drying, i.e. app. 4 weeks or min. 10 days/1 cm plaster thickness.
products.experts_advice: Suitable substrate: burnt bricks, stone masonry, lime sand bricks, concrete blocks, concrete, high-porous masonry. Moisten substrate. In case of unevenly absorbing or slightly absorbing substrate, use Baumit NHL pre-sprayed coat, curing time min. 3 days
products.product_benefit_2: For historical buildings and the protection of mon

seo.title: Baumit NHL MP
seo.description: Cement-free machine-applied plaster on the natural binder NHL basis with granularity 2 mm. Part of plaster systems MHL specially developed for reconstruction

products.name: Baumit NHL Fine
products.additional_name: Cement-free, mineral fine plaster on NHL basis
products.description: Cement-free, mineral fine plaster on NHL basis especially for the renovation of historical buildings and the protection of historic monuments. Hand and machine application for exterior and interior use, not suitable for plinth areas. Grain size 0.6 or 1 mm.
products.experts_advice_2: Apply plaster in two layers, systematically fresh to fresh. Max. thickness of one layer 2 – 3 mm.
products.experts_advice_3: Curing time before application of next layers is min. 5 days.
products.experts_advice: Stucco plaster applied on base floating coats, e.g. lime, lime cement, cement plasters and especially NHL plasters.
products.product_benefit_3: For historical buildings and mTraditional material

seo.title: Baumit NHL Fine
seo.description: Cement-free stucco plaster with fine or more grainy structure for reconstruction of historical structures. Granularity 1 mm or 0.6 mm.

products.name: Baumit SanovaPrimer
products.additional_name: Silicate primer for stabilising sandy, mineral plasters
products.description: Silicate primer for stabilising sandy, mineral plasters. Suitable for lime/cement and chalky plasters. Can also be used as thinner for Baumit SanovaColor.

seo.title: Baumit SanovaPrimer
seo.description: Base coat for bolstering and unifying the absorption of the substrate before applying Baumit SanovaColor paint.

products.name: Baumit SanovaColor
products.additional_name: Ready-to-use, highly diffusible, mineral-based waterglass facade paint
products.description: Ready-to-use, highly diffusible, mineral-based waterglass facade paint for the protection and design of facades on old and new mineral plasters and putties. Especially suitable for monument protection and renovations for outside and inside. Priming and thinning with Baumit SanovaPrimer according to the product data sheet. Dyed available in the Baumit Life shades with the black final digits 4 to 9. 1 liter; approx. 1.6 kilograms.
products.gloss_level: G3 matt according to DIN EN 1062-1

Renovation of masonry with high moisture and salt content Baumit Sanova WTA System
Renovation of masonry with moisture and salt content Baumit Sanova L & S System
Renovation of masonry with moisture and salt content Baumit Sanova Uni System

seo.title: Baumit SanovaColor
seo.description: Highly vapour permeable matt mineral façade colour on the sodium silicate basis for painting the surface of old and new mineral plasters and screeds.

products.name: Baumit RatioGlatt
products.description: Single-layer gypsum plaster for machine application for interior areas including domestic kitchens and bathrooms up to moisture exposure class W3.
products.experts_advice_2: Surfaces to be tiled do not need to be felted or smoothed. In the case of a highly absorbent substrate, it is recommended that the substrate is sealed prior to tiling.
products.experts_advice: The advantage of a gypsum-containing lightweight plaster application: With lightweight plasters, the coverage is 20% higher than the coverage of normal plaster, since lightweight plasters contain Perlite as an additive, a porous construction material with a low density.
products.product_benefit_2: can be applied in one layer

videos.title: Plastering with gypsum plaster Baumit RatioGlatt
Preparation of the wall before plastering with gypsum plaster Baumit RatioGlatt

seo.title: Baumit RatioGlatt
seo.description: Single coat, machine-applied gypsum plaster, smooth surface Grain size 1 mm.

products.name: Baumit Divina Classic
products.description: Interior paint with good processing properties and good coverage. Processing: roller, brush, airless spray. Breathable, odorless drying, tested for  harmful substances. Available colored in the Baumit Life shades with the last digit 7, 8 and 9. Wet abrasion class: 3; Opacity: 2 at 7 m² / l; Degree  of gloss: dull matt. 1 liter ≙ approx. 1.6 kilograms.
products.experts_advice_2: Store securely sealed and in a cool and frost-free location. Can be stored unopened, in the original container, for 12 months.
products.experts_advice: Baumit Divina Classic may, in keeping with the coating build-up, be dilluted with water up to a maximum of 5%.

seo.title: Baumit Divina Classic
seo.description: Breathable interior dispersion paint with good coverage, in E.L.F. quality. Can be tinted with alkali-resistant solid colours or basic and tinting colours.

Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Very flexible, extremely weather-resistant, with excellent workability, guaranteeing long lasting performance. Formulated for demanding applications, weather conditions during processing and demanding substrates.
products.experts_advice_2: Create the reinforcement layer by applying 10 mm adhesive mortar with a notched trowel to the substrate. Press vertical strips of Baumit StarTex fibre-glass mesh into the fresh mortar with 10 cm overlap and then (or after applying additional material) smooth the surface. The reinforcement must not be visible. Reinforcement layer thickness min. 3 mm, max. 6 mm.
products.experts_advice: Baumit StarContact adhesive mortar can also be used for bonding and mortaring plinth XPS and EPS Perimeter insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Highly flexible cement adhesive mortar suitable for bonding and mortaring all insulation panels.
products.product_benefit_2_description: The façade plaster can be applied directly on the reinforced layer.
products.product_benefit_3_description: With excellent applicability, with guaranteed long life and rapid curing period.
products.sd_value: app. 0.15 m for a layer thickness of 3 mm

headline_t.int: As with House No. 11, this building was built with a solid brick construction without thermal insulation. However, it has an ETIC system and a diffusion-open inner coating.

text_t.int: This building was characterised by very good heat storage properties, which is due to the high specific building mass and the insulation of the building envelope. The evaluation of the measurement data showed a high level of moisture buffering, which was due to the good sorption characteristics of the interior plaster system that was used.

parameters.parameter_name: Protection against overheating in the summer
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A higher value means a higher protection against overheating of the interior in summer.
A higher value means a more stable temperature.
A higher value means the wall can regulate the humidity better.

parameters.parameter_name: Fluctuation of the inner surface temperature
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A lower value means a more balanced indoor temperature feeling.
A higher value means better protection against outdoor noise.
A higher value means better acoustics due to better protection against echo.

parameters.parameter_name: Absorption of high frequency electromagnetic fields
parameters.parameter_tooltip: A higher value means a better protection against the most common mobile frequencies.
A lower value means less noticeable odour

buildings.headline: House No. 13 was built from aerated concrete blocks and has external insulation.
buildings.text: The building was solidly in the middle range in terms of heat storage behaviour and protection against overheating in summer. The good sorption capacity of the interior coating that was used ensured very good moisture buffering and stable room humidity. The building also scored very well in terms of soundproofing.

products.name: Baumit openContact
products.additional_name: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit openSystem. Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Highly vapor permeable, very flexible, extremely resistant to weathering featuring excellent workability. For objects with highest quality demands on indoor climate - for a house that breaths.
products.experts_advice_2: Generally speaking, the Baumit OpenContact system is used for thermal insulation anywhere where a thermal insulation system with a high level of water vapour permeability is required, and thus also for the thermal insulation of porous concrete block walls. We therefore recommend the specific evaluation of the thermal insulation recommendation for thermal insulation for the structure in question and that you take into account the specific type of porous concrete brick. Our colleagues at the Baumit Consultancy Centre will be happy to assist you in this regard.
products.experts_advice_3: Thanks to the white putty, you can easily check whether Baumit OpenContact was actually used on your façade!
products.experts_advice: On account of its good adhesive properties, Baumit OpenContact can be used for gluing (or smoothing) XPS insulating panels. N.B. in this case the high water vapour permeability of the material no longer applies.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Particularly suitable for structures with higher demands for interior quality.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Adhesive mortar for bonding and mortaring insulation panels in the Baumit Open system.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Exceptional quality adhesive mortar, highly flexible and with excellent workability.

seo.title: Baumit openContact
seo.description: Breathable, mineral-based, fibre-reinforced, white powder adhesive and plaster undercoat – specially developed for Baumit Open - KlimaFaçade.

products.experts_advice: For bonding and mortaring, use the highly vapour permeable Baumit ProContact adhesive mortar.

products.product_benefit_3_description: Thanks to its features particularly suitable for highly vapour-permeable masonry, such as porous concrete.

products.description: Highly weather-resistant facade render with silicone binder and new functional filler. The all new Drypor effect guarantees a quick-drying facade surface after rain, fog and condensation.
products.experts_advice_2: New recipe enables the expansion of the assortment of paint color tones. StarTop plaster is available in up to 758 colors, i.e. in all shades of Baumit Life (ending digits 2 through 9), with the exception of the most saturated colors (ending digit 1). Also available in all structures.
products.experts_advice_3: With the hydrophilic capabilities of the render, the surface of your façade will dry out in moist weather far sooner than with regular renders. Hydrophobic characteristics also provide rapid drainage of raindrops from the surface. The combination of both functions keeps the surface dry and also more resistant to dirt and algae.
products.experts_advice: If you’re longing for an absolutely gleaming façade, reach for StarTop render in Life 0019 shade. Special ingredients and pigments ensure whiter shades.
products.product_benefit_1_description: The combination of hydrophilic and hydrophobic characteristics reduces the load of the façade surface due to moisture.
products.product_benefit_2_description: With its rapid drying surface, your façade will be more resistant to dirt and the effects of microorganisms.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Simple application ensures a good result in each of the six structures offered.

headline_t.int: House No. 13 was built from aerated concrete blocks and has external insulation.

text_t.int: The building was solidly in the middle range in terms of heat storage behaviour and protection against overheating in summer. The good sorption capacity of the interior coating that was used ensured very good moisture buffering and stable room humidity. The building also scored very well in terms of soundproofing.

products.name: Baumit openContact
products.additional_name: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar
products.description: Unique, high quality adhesive and reinforcing mortar with white cement, especially for Baumit openSystem. Complying, with a high degree of safety, to all parameters required by ETAG 004. Highly vapor permeable, very flexible, extremely resistant to weathering featuring excellent workability. For objects with highest quality demands on indoor climate - for a house that breaths.
products.experts_advice_2: Generally speaking, the Baumit OpenContact system is used for thermal insulation anywhere where a thermal insulation system with a high level of water vapour permeability is required, and thus also for the thermal insulation of porous concrete block walls. We therefore recommend the specific evaluation of the thermal insulation recommendation for thermal insulation for the structure in question and that you take into account the specific type of porous concrete brick. Our colleagues at the Baumit Consultancy Centre will be happy to assist you in this regard.
products.experts_advice_3: Thanks to the white putty, you can easily check whether Baumit OpenContact was actually used on your façade!
products.experts_advice: On account of its good adhesive properties, Baumit OpenContact can be used for gluing (or smoothing) XPS insulating panels. N.B. in this case the high water vapour permeability of the material no longer applies.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Particularly suitable for structures with higher demands for interior quality.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Adhesive mortar for bonding and mortaring insulation panels in the Baumit Open system.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Exceptional quality adhesive mortar, highly flexible and with excellent workability.

additional_content.name: VIVA: Humidifier
additional_content.title: Humidifier
additional_content.content: Humans in homes breathe, produce moisture by cooking, showering and washing and in winter they heat their homes to make them comfortable. Cooking is one of the primary sources of moisture in the household, in addition to showers, and can have a significant effect on the interior humidity. Therefore, the project needed measurable factors for these behaviors. To do so, the scientists decided to install a "mini ventilation system" in each house to simulate a defined air supply and an air humidification system as well as installing underfloor heating including an electricity meter.

content_t.int: Humans in homes breathe, produce moisture by cooking, showering and washing and in winter they heat their homes to make them comfortable. Cooking is one of the primary sources of moisture in the household, in addition to showers, and can have a significant effect on the interior humidity. Therefore, the project needed measurable factors for these behaviors. To do so, the scientists decided to install a "mini ventilation system" in each house to simulate a defined air supply and an air humidification system as well as installing underfloor heating including an electricity meter.
content_t.fr: Humans in homes breathe, produce moisture by cooking, showering and washing and in winter they heat their homes to make them comfortable. Cooking is one of the primary sources of moisture in the household, in addition to showers, and can have a significant effect on the interior humidity. Therefore, the project needed measurable factors for these behaviors. To do so, the scientists decided to install a "mini ventilation system" in each house to simulate a defined air supply and an air humidification system as well as installing underfloor heating including an electricity meter.

additional_content.name: VIVA: Air supply
additional_content.title: Air Supply
additional_content.content: To ensure the specified ventilation rates, the scientists incorporated a "mini ventilation system" with an air supply into all research houses. The operating scenario for ventilating the research houses was set so that multiple window ventilations per day were simulated. During the winter period, a ventilation cycle with a duration of 1.5 h each was performed in the morning and in the evening. during the summer period, this was adjusted from 2 to 3 ventilation cycles. This ensured that all of the room air was largely replaced during each ventilation cycle.

The operating scenario for ventilating the research houses was set so that multiple window ventilations per day were simulated. During the winter period, a ventilation cycle with a duration of 1.5 h each was performed in the morning and in the evening. during the summer period, this was adjusted from 2 to 3 ventilation cycles. This ensured that all of the room air was largely replaced during each ventilation cycle.
content_t.fr: To ensure the specified ventilation rates, the scientists incorporated a "mini ventilation system" with an air supply into all research houses. The operating scenario for ventilating the research houses was set so that multiple window ventilations per day were simulated. During the winter period, a ventilation cycle with a duration of 1.5 h each was performed in the morning and in the evening. during the summer period, this was adjusted from 2 to 3 ventilation cycles. This ensured that all of the room air was largely replaced during each ventilation cycle.

additional_content.name: VIVA: Air exhaust
additional_content.title: Air Exhaust
additional_content.content: The exhaust air and supply in the room were arranged to be diagonally offset. The defined air exchange rate was achieved by means of a fan which was integrated into the exhaust air opening.

content_t.int: The exhaust air and supply in the room were arranged to be diagonally offset. The defined air exchange rate was achieved by means of a fan which was integrated into the exhaust air opening.
content_t.fr: The exhaust air and supply in the room were arranged to be diagonally offset. The defined air exchange rate was achieved by means of a fan which was integrated into the exhaust air opening.

additional_content.name: VIVA: Global Temperature Sensor
additional_content.title: Global Temperature Sensor
additional_content.content: Comprehensive measurement data was collected around the clock in each Viva Research Park house. In the first two years of the project alone, more than 5 Million items of data were measured and analyzed. Alongside the global temperature 31 measurement sensors were installed which recorded all the relevant physical measured variables around the clock.

In the first two years of the project alone, more than 5 Million items of data were measured and analyzed. Alongside the global temperature 31 measurement sensors were installed which recorded all the relevant physical measured variables around the clock.

additional_content.name: VIVA: House 8, result: Insulation first
additional_content.title: Insulation first
additional_content.content: Good insulation ensures a balanced interior climate and improves the overall living comfort. An uninsulated brick house needs 2.5 times more energy in comparison to an insulated one*. In other words, in an insulated house you need only 40% of the actual energy costs.  * With reference to the outer walls with same roof and floor insulation.

content_t.int: Good insulation ensures a balanced interior climate and improves the overall living comfort. An uninsulated brick house needs 2.5 times more energy in comparison to an insulated one*. In other words, in an insulated house you need only 40% of the actual energy costs.  * With reference to the outer walls with same roof and floor insulation.
content_t.fr: Good insulation ensures a balanced interior climate and improves the overall living comfort. An uninsulated brick house needs 2.5 times more energy in comparison to an insulated one*. In other words, in an insulated house you need only 40% of the actual energy costs.  * With reference to the outer walls with same roof and floor insulation.

additional_content.name: VIVA: House 8, result: Solidity counts
additional_content.title: Solidity counts
additional_content.content: Thick walls serve as an energy regulator. Houses with good insulation and thick walls save energy best and equalise short-term temperature fluctuations optimally. It does not matter whether we are talking about hot or cold days.  Of course, there can be different needs for different projects:  Brick and plaster is the best for climate control Concrete and plaster provides good sound insulation and protection against electrosmog Solid wood is good for room acoustics and room climate regulation

additional_content.name: VIVA: House 8, result: Interior values
additional_content.title: Interior values
additional_content.content: Klima interior plasters with 1,5 cm thickness make a significant contribution to regulating air humidity of interior walls and reduce the development of health-damaging organisms. People feel most comfortable with air humidity ranging between 40% - 60%.

additional_content.name: VIVA: House 8, partners
additional_content.title: Scientific cooperation partners
additional_content.content: In order to conduct and evaluate all of the different measurements the research team had to involve project partners from a variety of scientific fields. This was the only possible way to thoroughly test the interactions of the individual building materials. For three years, a ten-member team of renowned scientists worked together. Jürgen Lorenz: "The success of this project was due to the fact that many different scientific disciplines, such as construction, metrology, building physics and medicine, all cooperated on this interdisciplinary work. Something like this had practically never been done before."

subtitles.start_welcome: Welcome to the VIVA research park. Europe’s largest comparative research project for building materials.
subtitles.start_quote: “We want everyone to live in a healthy, energy-efficient and beautiful way.”
subtitles.start_quote_source: This motto of our chief Robert Schmid led to a project that is unique in the industry: with VIVA, Baumit’s research park, Europe’s largest research project for the comparison of different building materials and construction methods was created.
subtitles.start_come_along: Come along to our VIVA Park and see for yourself how different the indoor climate feels in the individual houses.
subtitles.house_8_healthy_living: Baumit has been exploring and working on “healthy living” for years and over time it became very clear that there are too few well-founded statements about the effects of building materials on health and well-being.
subtitles.house_8_data_method_1: Over 5 million data have been measured, collected and evaluated since 2015. But, of course, not only within the company; after all, the evaluations should be scientific and independent.
subtitles.house_8_data_method_2: So, the Viva Research Park was created as a joint project with the University of Applied Sciences Burgenland, the Medical University of Vienna and the Austrian Institute for Building Biology and Ecology.
subtitles.house_8_data_method_3: The measurements are used for product development and basic research in the field of “healthy living”.
subtitles.house_10_construction: This house is built out of 20 cm solid wood and insulated with 20 cm NatureTherm (soft wood fibre board). Next to stone, wood is the oldest building material. It is stable, elastic and currently very popular as a renewable raw material.
subtitles.house_10_results: …. Results from research and experiences from other visitors have shown that the strengths of this construction method are very good moisture balance, good room acoustics and high attenuation of electromagnetic fields. Weaknesses could be the low protection against overheating in summer and a noticeable smell.
subtitles.house_6_construction: Letʼs move on to House 6, a timber frame construction with 6 cm thick StarTherm external insulation, plasterboard on the inside and painted with an emulsion paint. About one third of all 1-2 family houses in Austria are already built this way. The reason: lower costs and shorter construction time. A disadvantage: In addition to the intense smell, due to the low mass of the walls, both the sound insulation and the protection against overheating in summer can be classified as low. Everything clear?
subtitles.house_6_desc_1: In the individual houses, which consist of different building and insulating materials, typical user behaviour is simulated, like cooking, showering, ventilating, etc.
subtitles.house_6_method_1: For the building materials used, contemporary products were deliberately chosen that are available on the market, such as concrete, bricks, solid wood and timber frame constructions with various interior and exterior coatings.
subtitles.house_6_method_2: There are 33 measuring sensors in each house, which record a wide variety of physical parameters around the clock. The building materials used are examined for toxicological interactions, well-being, comfort and effects on health.
subtitles.house_6_method_3: Tests showed great indoor acoustic results compared to other construction methods
subtitles.house_2_construction: House 2 is about dense construction. Wherever small plots of land are to be used optimally, concrete is the preferred choice. Insulation was provided with 20 cm of breathable Baumit open air thermal insulation. The interior was plastered with KlimaWhite, filled with IonitFinish and painted with IonitColor.
subtitles.house_2_research_1: Our research has shown: Thanks to the high storage mass of concrete, we have very good heat storage behaviour here and, in combination with thermal insulation, good protection against overheating in summer and rapid cooling in winter. The sound insulation is excellent. Thanks to the Klima plaster, the moisture buffering is also good, so there is a balanced climate, not too damp and not too dry.
subtitles.house_2_research_2: The smell in here is unobtrusive. The room acoustics are in the middle range. With this construction method, we are very close to ideal conditions.
subtitles.house_4_construction: Here, in house number 4, you will really feel completely at home. How do we know that? Research has told us. This house was built with 25 cm bricks and insulated with the breathable 18 cm Baumit open air thermal insulation.
subtitles.house_4_method_1: The interior was plastered with KlimaWhite and painted with KlimaColor. This created ideal conditions. We have an optimally balanced indoor climate and moisture behaviour here thanks to the KlimaWhite plaster on the inside and the thermal insulation on the outside. The sound insulation values and room acoustics are in the good to medium range. The odour is unobtrusive and in terms of comfort, this house occupies the top spot.
subtitles.house_4_method_2: So, stay a little longer and enjoy the perfect feel-good climate.

products.name: Baumit NanoporTop
products.description: Revêtement minéral épais (RME), à base de silicate de potassium, prêt à l’emploi, en phase aqueuse et à faible encrassement (enduit de finition). Enduit à talocher à structure grattée pour l’extérieur. Applicable à la main ou à la machine. Pour application extérieure uniquement.
products.experts_advice: Bien homogénéiser le seau avant application avec un agitateur à vitesse lente. Appliquer sur toute la surface à l’aide d’une taloche en acier inox, régler en fonction de la taille des grains et resserrer à l’aide d’une taloche en plastique. Pour éviter les effets de reprise, travailler de manière régulière et sans interruption.
products.product_benefit_1_description: Elimination naturelle des salissures grâce à l'énergie solaire, au vent et à l'eau.
products.product_benefit_2_description: Grâce à la technologie photokat qui offre la meilleure protection contre les salissures.
products.product_benefit_3_description: Liant au silicate offrant les mêmes capacités respirantes que la chaux
tags: Baumit PowerSystem : haute résistance aux chocs
